Any spells that take a minute or more to cast are also considered a ritual.

When you choose this feat, you acquire a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. Choose one of the following classes: {@filter bard|spells|level=1|class=bard|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=1|class=cleric|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}, {@filter druid|spells|level=1|class=druid|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=1|class=sorcerer|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=1|class=warlock|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=1|class=wizard|components & miscellaneous=ritual|source=yastah}. You must choose your spells from that class's spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. The class you choose also determines your spellcasting ability for these spells: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

If you come across a spell in written form, such as a magical spell scroll or a wizard's spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be on the spell list for the class you chose, the spell's level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.
Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the {@action Disengage} action before leaving your reach.

When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature {@color (This does not count as an attack of opportunity!)|e40707}.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You have mastered ranged weapons and can make shots that others find impossible. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.
Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

feat.name: Shield Master
entries: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a {@item shield|phb}:

items: If you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to {@action shove} a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

feat.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@book skills|phb|7|skills} or {@filter tools|items|type=tools;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)|source=yastah} of your choice.

feat.name: Skulker
entries: You are expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled.
Your ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

You learn one cantrip that requires an attack roll. Choose the cantrip from the {@filter bard|spells|level=0|class=bard|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0|class=cleric|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0|class=druid|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0|class=sorcerer|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0|class=warlock|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=wizard|spell attack=m;r;o|source=yastah} spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip depends on the spell list you chose from: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised weapons.
Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage d4} for damage.
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

feat.name: Tough
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points per level.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.
You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item shield|yastah} in one or both hands.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice.

feat.name: Arcane Ammunitionist*
entries: You have developed the magical ability of conjuring ammunition and returning weapons you throw, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to ranged attack rolls.

You can conjure a piece of mundane ammunition (such as {@item arrow|yastah|arrows} for bows, {@item crossbow bolt|yastah|bolts} for crossbows, or {@item sling bullet|yastah|stones} for slings) as part of an attack with a ranged weapon. The conjured ammunition disappears after 1 round.
Immediately after you make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, you can cause the weapon to teleport into your hand.
You ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.
You also ignore the reload of firearms that use {@item bullet|yastah|basic bullets} and {@item slug|yastah|slugs}. {@color NO OTHER ROUNDS WILL WORK|e40707}

feat.name: Arcane Focus*
entries: During a short rest you can perform a 1 hour long ritual to attune your weapon to arcane energy. Doing so will grant the following benefits:

items: You use your melee weapon to channel your arcane energy.
Apply any magic bonus from the weapon to any spell attack rolls you make.
You can perform touch spells through your melee weapon.

feat.name: Archery Champion*
entries: You triumphed in countless contests of archery and have learned to use your bow to its fullest, granting the following benefits:

items: When you make a ranged attack with the weapon against targets who have disadvantage on Dexterity checks or Dexterity saving throws, add your Strength modifier to the attack roll.

You have learned to use your bow in acrobatic maneuvers. You can add your proficiency bonus for Acrobatics checks made while carrying a shortbow or longbow. If you are already proficient in Acrobatics, you can instead add double your proficiency bonus.

You can attempt to intercept an opponent's ranged weapon attack with one of your own. When a creature that you can see makes a ranged weapon attack against another creature that you can see, you can use your reaction to make a ranged attack with your weapon against the opponent's projectile. The projectile's AC is equal to the opponent's attack roll plus 5. On a hit, the opponent's attack misses. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected)

feat.name: Battlemage*
entries: You've learned to empower your spells, drawing every bit of power you can from the Weave. You gain the following benefits:

items: Before you make a spell attack roll for a cantrip, you can choose to take a -5 penalty on the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 damage to the spell's damage.

Before you cast a spell that requires a saving throw to avoid damage, you can choose to lower the spell's saving throw DC by an amount up to your proficiency bonus. If a target fails the saving throw to avoid damage, they receive an additional 1 point of damage per damage dice of the spell for every 2 that the DC is lowered by.

When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon (Not an unarmed attack of any kind), you can immediately make an attack against another creature within reach with the same weapon. Before making the extra attack make a new attack roll.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls, excluding spells.
You can attempt to {@action shove} a creature who is 2 sizes larger than you or smaller.
When you successfully {@action shove} a creature, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 0) and you may push them an additional 5 feet away from you.
When you make a Strength check to break restraints, damage an object, or win a contest of Strength, you gain advantage on that roll.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls (only applicable for spells).
You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.
Your throwing range for daggers increases to 30/90 feet.
Any hit you score with a dagger against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.
You gain advantage on any Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks to conceal a dagger on your person.

You can add your spellcasting modifier to damage rolls made with cantrips, You can only gain your Ability modifier to one Damage roll per cantrip! (Green flame blade gets this to the first damage with this feat. And keeps it on the second damage)
You can cast spells without verbal components.

feat.name: Elemental Specialist*
entries: You specialize in casting spells of a specific element.

items: You are able to emulate other damaging spells using your preferred element, but you are unable to deal any other type of spell damage.

When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types that you have already taken elemental adept in: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Damaging spells of any element listed that you cast deal damage of the chosen type instead of their normal damage.
When you hit a creature that is immune to damage of the chosen type, it takes damage as if it had resistance rather than immunity.

feat.name: Eldritch Master*
entries: Whenever you take this feat choose two of the following effects. Then when you cast Eldritch Blast you can apply one of those effects:

items: Eldritch Blast deals 1d12 damage per beam.
Eldritch Blast deals 1d10 Fire damage and can ignite small flammable objects, such as tinder or paper.

Instead of an attack roll, the target makes a Dexterity save. On a failed save, the target takes 1d8 per beam cold damage and reduces their movement speed by 10 ft their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and no other effects.

Instead of an attack roll, the target makes a Constitution save. On a failed save, the target takes 1d8 thunder damage per beam, and loses their reaction this turn. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and no other effects.
Eldritch Blast deals 1d8 acid damage per beam to all creatures in a 15 ft cone. On a successful Constitution save, they take half.
Eldritch Blast deals 1d8 lightning damage per beam to each creature in a 30 ft line. On a successful Dexterity save, they take half.

entries.name: NOTE
entries: All of the area effects are one attack instead of multiple beams

feat.name: Fast Hands*
entries: As a bonus action, you can take the Use an Object action, make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check, or use thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock.

items: When you score a critical hit with an rapier, you can roll 1 additional damage dice and add it to the extra damage for the critical hit.
When you are wielding a rapier in one hand and nothing in your other hand, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

As a bonus action, you can make a feinting moves to beguile a hostile creature within 10 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC equals 8 plus your proficiency bonus plus your Dexterity modifier. On a failed save, you have advantage on the next attack on that creature until the start of your next turn. Whether they succeed or fail, the creature is immune to being affected by this feature again for 1 hour.

entries: When hurt you've trained yourself to get out of danger quickly. While below one-quarter of your hit-point maximum (rounded down), you gain the following benefits:

items: Your speed increases by 20 feet
You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action

feat.name: Focused Multitasker*
entries: You can maintain your concentration on two spells or effects that requires concentration, instead of one.

feat.name: Greater Familiar*
entries: Your familiar can be any medium, small or tiny beast with a CR of 1 or lower.
You can use your reaction to cast the spells Shield or Absorb Elements when your familiar is attacked if you already know these spells.

items: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist or remove Fear and Madness effects.
While you are at or below half of your hit point maximum, you add half of your proficiency bonus to any saving throws you are not already proficient in.

entries: When using a ranged weapon ({@color NOT THROWN|e40707}), you gain the following benefits:

items: When you critically hit an enemy add another damage Dice to the damage roll

You weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. If they already do, then your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. If they already do, then your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 17-20.
Once per day, you ignore the effects of the first level of Exhaustion/Fatigue incurred for 12 hours.
Each Long Rest you reduce your level of Exhaustion by 2.

feat.name: Last Breath*
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

items: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

You weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. If they already do, then your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. If they already do, then your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 17-20.
You learn one {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM} option from the list available to the sorcerer class.
When you use this Metamagic option, you can apply your normal spellcasting ability instead of Charisma, as appropriate.
If you already have sorcery points, you gain two more. Otherwise you have 2 sorcery points. These are used to fuel your Metamagic. You regain your expended sorcery points at the end of a long rest.
Gain 2 to Passive Perception
Once per long rest, if you fail a perception check, you can reroll it and take the second roll.

While blinded or you otherwise can't see, once per long rest you can use an action to get blindsight for 30 ft. for up to 1 hour or until you can see again, whichever comes first. This feature is deactivated if you are Deafened, and cannot be activated while Deafened.
You may take an additional reaction each round. Readied actions can still only be taken once.
You can use both of your reactions to make an opportunity attack with advantage.
You can use both of your reactions to make an opportunity attack against an opponent who has taken the Disengage action.
You can use your reaction to gain advantage on a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration on a spell.

When you miss an attack roll against a target, you gain a +1 cumulative bonus to attack rolls you make against that target until you hit within the next minute, or you attack another target. The maximum bonus to attack rolls you can receive from this feature is +3.

Every successful consecutive attack roll you make against a target adds a cumulative +1 to your damage rolls. This bonus damage only applies to damage rolls from attacks you make against that target and is lost when you miss your target or you attack another target. The maximum bonus damage you can have from this feature is +5.
You can use your use bonus action heighten your reflexes. When you do, you can make up to two opportunity attacks without using your reaction until the start of your next turn.

when you move 15 feet or more in a straight line you can take an action to charge an enemy with your shield. Make a melee weapon attack roll, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage and knocking them prone on a hit.

feat.name: Spellcasting Affinity*
entries: You have become adept at casting particular spells, so they take on additional effects. When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder. You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.
When you damage a target with the chosen damage type using a spell of 1st level or higher, an additional effect applies:

rows: The target takes a -2 penalty to its AC until the start of your next turn.
The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
The target is set ablaze and takes 1d6 fire damage per turn until put out.
The target is pushed back up to 5 feet.
The target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.
The target can't regain hit points until the end of your next turn.
The target is poisoned until the start of your next turn.
The target is blinded until the start of your next turn.
The target is deafened until the start of your next turn.

items: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack using Strength, the target's speed is reduced to 0 and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

You gain proficiency in stealth. If you already have proficiency in stealth, you add double your proficiency bonus when you make Stealth checks. If you already had double proficiency in Stealth, you gain advantage.
While hidden you add +2 damage rolls.
As long as you are conscious, you cannot be shoved or knocked prone by creatures no more than one size larger than you.
You have advantages on Strength checks and saving throws against being shoved or knocked prone.

As a bonus action, you can take a defensive stance until the start of your next turn. While you are in the defensive stance, the area within 5 feet of you are considered as difficult terrain for your enemies, and other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter the area within 5 feet of you. The defensive stance ends early if you move or are incapacitated.
You learn one fighting style of your choice from the list available to the fighter class. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
As an action, you can end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be frightened. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.
If three or more hostile creatures are within 5 feet of you, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC.
When you use a whip, its damage die changes from d4 to d6.

When you hit a creature no more than one size larger than you with a whip on your turn, you can use a bonus action to pull the target up to 5 feet towards you. When you do this, you can immediately try to grapple it, try to shove it to knock it prone, or make a melee attack against it with a light weapon you are holding as if you were using two-weapon fighting.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can increase your reach with a whip by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.

You can use your action to make a melee weapon attack against all hostile creatures within your weapon's reach. If you do so, you make a single attack roll and compare the result to each target's AC, and you make a single damage roll for all creatures you hit with the attack.
You gain an advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

During a short or long rest, you can attune yourself to your senses, as if attuning to a magic item. You gain blindsight in a radius of 30 feet until you complete a short or long rest that you do not spend attuning yourself in this way. You lose this benefit while you are deafened.
When you make a high jump, you leap into the air a number of feet equal to 6 + twice your Strength modifier if you move at least 10 feet on foot immediately before the jump.
When you make a Strength (Athletics) check to climb, you are considered proficient in Athletics and add your twice your proficiency bonus instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
You gain resistance to falling damage.
You do not need to sleep, and magic cannot put you into sleep. You can spend 8 hours of light activity and still gain the benefit of long rest.
You have advantage on saving throws to avoid falling unconscious.
You gain proficiency in the Deception skill. if you already have it you gain Expertice in it.
You gain proficiency in the Disguise Kit. Other creatures have disadvantage on Perception checks to see through your disguises.

otherSummary.entry: Ability score applicable to skills must be 13 or higher

items: Choose two skills or tools you are proficient with. When you make a check with one of these chosen proficiencies, you may add double your proficiency bonus instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
You may take this feat multiple times but never for the same skill.
You gain proficiency in the Sleight of Hand skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the Sleight of Hands skill.
You gain advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks that involves stealing an object from other creatures' person.
Other creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice an object you palmed in your hands.

If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn if the creature has a purse, wallet, pouch, or other similar object that contains at least 1 gp worth of valuables.
The weight you can push, drag, or lift is doubled.
You have advantage on all Strength checks made to push, drag, or lift objects.
You have advantage on all Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks against being shoved or grappled.

You gain proficiency with ropes and nets. Proficiency with ropes allows you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft, repair, or dismantle ropes and objects made of rope such as nets, traps, ladders, and bridges. In addition, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks made when interacting with rope, such as when attempting to remove bindings, climbing with ropes, or crossing unstable rope bridges. Finally, you add your proficiency bonus plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the DC of any ability checks made by a creature to free itself or another creature from bindings, traps, or nets you have made with rope.
You can make bindings or release any bindings you have made as a bonus action. In addition, you can use rope or a net to restrain a grappled creature as a bonus action.
Attacking at long range or being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with nets.

Before rolling any of your attacks as part of your attack action, you can choose to exchange one Extra Attack for an additional damage die on all other attacks for that turn (Main hand only), and gain a +1 to hit on those attacks.
You must announce that you are using this feat before rolling any attacks.
If you have multiple Extra Attacks, this feat can apply to more than one of them, gaining 1 damage die and an additional +1 to hit for each Extra Attack you negate.
This does not effect spells, but will effect magical weaponry like psionic blades.

feat.name: Bodyguard*
entries: Your extensive of being a bodyguard has trained you to constantly be on guard, and reflexively act when your charge is in danger.

items: You gain proficiency in perception, or if you already had proficiency gain +3 to your passive perception.
Choose one creature to be your charge before a mission starts, cannot be someone who has this feat.
When ever your charge is within 30ft of you they gain +1 to saving throws.
When you are within 5ft of your charge they gain +2 to AC.
If any creature within your melee range attempts an attack on your charge you may use your reaction to attempt to stop the attack. You must make an attack of your own equal or higher to their roll
You gain Tremor Sense 30ft radius
You can only have Tremor Sense up if you are currently attuned to Blind Sight
When you gain this feat, choose either radiant or necrotic.
Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Light/Shadow Specialist*
entries: You specialize in casting spells of a specific type.

items: You are able to emulate other damaging spells using your preferred element, but you are unable to deal any other type of spell damage.
When you gain this feat, choose radiant or necrotic.
Damaging spells of any damage type listed that you cast deal damage of the chosen type instead of their normal damage.
Radiant: changes acid, cold, thunder, Necrotic.
Necrotic: changes fire, lightning, thunder, Radiant.
When you hit a creature that is immune to damage of the chosen type, it takes damage as if it had resistance rather than immunity.

feat.name: Showdown Veteran*
entries: You have won many showdowns, keeping your calm in high pressure situations lets you better observe and predict your enemy's movements.

items: When you make a ranged attack with a gun against targets who have disadvantage on Dexterity checks or Dexterity Saving Throws, add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll.

You have learned to use your gun in acrobatic maneuvers. You can add your proficiency bonus for Acrobatics checks made while carrying a gun. If you are already proficient in Acrobatics, you can instead add double your proficiency bonus.

You can attempt to intercept an opponent's ranged weapon attack with one of your own. When a creature that you can see makes a ranged weapon attack against another creature that you can see, you can use your reaction to make a ranged attack with your gun against the opponent's projectile. The projectile's AC is equal to the opponent's attack roll plus 5. On a hit, the opponent's attack misses. ({@color Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected|e40707})

feat.name: Stealth Grapple*
entries: When hidden from your target and an others that might have seen you approach (Allies excluded) you have advantage on your grapple check. If you succeed, you may use your reaction to follow it with one of the following moves. If you fail, you provoke an attack of opportunity or grapple of opportunity from your target. The move effect applies as long as the stealth grapple is maintained. While maintaining it, creatures other than your target have advantage on attack rolls against you, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

items: Gag: You attempt to gag the target's mouth to prevent it from making any sound. Make another opposed Grapple check with your target. On a success, the target is gagged until the grapple ends. A gagged creature cannot cast spells with verbal components and its speech is muffled and difficult to understand.

Choke Hold: You try to grab the creature by the throat and prevent it from breathing. Make another opposed Grapple check with your target with a disadvantage. On a success, the target is also gagged and suffocating until the grapple ends.

entries: Once you have them grappled and gaged you can do a Silent Take-down as one of your attack actions. (For reference an grapple attempt is an attack action. So if you only have one attack this will have to wait until your next turn if you have more then one then you may do this.)

items: Silent take-down: If your target is already grappled and gagged, you may attempt to strike it with a weapon with Silent property. Make an opposed Grapple check to maintain the hold on your target. If you succeed, you can make a single special melee attack at advantage. The damage from this attack is doubled.

feat.name: Drow Dark Arts*
entries: You have tapped the power of your vile heritage and gained greater magical ability. When you reach 5th level, the {@spell spider climb|yastah} and {@spell web|yastah} spells are added to your Drow Magic trait, and you can cast each spell once. Once you cast either spell, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.

feat.name: Celestial Arts*
entries: You have tapped into the power of your celestial heritage and gained greater magical abilities. When you reach 5th level, the {@spell lesser restoration|yastah} and {@spell warding bond|yastah} spells are added to your Celestial Legacy trait, and you can cast each spell once per day. Once you cast either spell, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.

feat.name: Fiendish Arts*
entries: You have tapped into the power of your hellish heritage and gained greater magical abilities. When you reach 5th level, the {@spell alter self|yastah} and {@spell heat metal|yastah} spells are added to your Infernal Legacy trait, and you can cast each spell once per day. Once you cast either spell, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.

feat.name: Steel Wings*
entries: Through determination and your birthright to the sky, you have become a feat of aerial excellence. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can now dash as a Bonus Action while you are flying, doubling your basic flying speed
Hostiles cannot be granted an attack of opportunity on you while you are flying past them

feat.name: Divine Awareness*
entries: The blood of the Archangels runs through you, and like them, nothing in the way of words gets by you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Insight. If you are already proficient, your proficiency becomes expertise.
You gain a +5 to your passive Insight.

feat.name: Prime Sentience*
entries: You have studied your inner workings to the greatest extent you possibly can. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with Tinkerer's tools. If you were already proficient, you gain expertise.
Once per day, as an Action, you can repair yourself with your Tinkerer's tools. Gain your INT mod + 1d6 + your level in HP. You gain an extra d6 at 5th, 11th, 17th, 21st, 25th, 31st, and 37th levels.

feat.name: Primal Instinct*
entries: Cartian strong! Strong good! Cartian be STRONGER!!! You gain the following benefits:

items: Once per day you can activate your Primal Instinct at the start of your turn. During that turn, all attacks made with a Strength modifier will have advantage. This advantage cannot be removed by any class ability applying to you at this time.

feat.name: Bloodsucker*
entries: You need to feed. This need consumes you. It will drive you. It will control you... at least until you're no longer hungry. You gain the following benefits:

items: You become proficient in Athletics. If you are already proficient in Athletics, you gain expertise.
You can now use Siphon Kiss as a Bonus Action.

feat.name: Dragon Hide*
entries: Your scales and claws develop a reminiscence to your Dragon ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can choose one of the two following benefits, but not both. This feat can be taken more than once to receive both benefits:
Your scales harden. While not wearing armor, your AC becomes 13+DEX. You can still have this benefit while using a shield.
You grow retractable claws. Extending or retracting your claws requires no action. You can use the claws to make unarmed strikes, which will do 1d4+STR in slashing damage.

feat.name: Skybound Imitation*
entries: The skies bless you, whether you know it or not. You gain the following benefits:

items: The time of day no longer slows you down. When the celestial body in the sky is not the one you were born under, your speed will be its base 30.

Once per day, you can create Sunlight or Moonlight respectively. This racial Spell makes you glow with 10 ft of bright light, requires concentration to keep active, and lasts for 1 minute. When you create your respective light during the time of day in which you'd normally gain no benefits, you do gain those benefits while the spell is active. Only your own spell can give you this effect.

feat.name: Dwarven Fortitude*
entries: Your people are that of the ancient heroes. Do them proud! You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you take the dodge action in combat, you can roll a 1d10 and regain HP equivalent to the roll + your CON modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your CON modifier per day.

feat.name: Voice of the Fairies*
entries: The beings of Yastah are lesser, and so you must be greater. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can choose to gain proficiency in either Persuasion or Deception.
You have advantage on persuasion and deception rolls against creatures with the Blood of Man:
Humans
Gnomes
Dwarves
Halflings.

feat.name: Flower Power*
entries: You have an innate wonderment of the world around you, but these people need to be more careful with fire! You gain the following benefits:

items: You become proficient in the Nature skill. If you are already proficient, you gain Expertise.
When you use your Charcoal or Pleasant Aroma ability, you become resistant to the fire damage of the triggering attack instead of vulnerable.

feat.name: Elemental Disposition*
entries: You learn to spread the power of your body onto the weapons that you carry. You gain the following benefits:

items: Once per day you can infuse a weapon you hold with your given element for 1 minute. Your weapon gains a 1d4 enchantment (listed below) and makes the weapon count as magical for the duration:

feat.name: Tempered Shards*
entries: Being in this new realm has caused you to become inventive as to how you keep yourself from cracking under the strain. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with Glassblower's tools. If you are already proficient, you gain Expertise.

Once per day, as an Action, you can repair yourself with your Glassblower's tools. Gain your Cha mod + 1d6 + your level in HP. You gain an extra d6 at 5th, 11th, 17th, 21st, 25th, 31st, and 37th levels.

feat.name: Fade Away*
entries: You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:

items: -Immediately after you take damage, you can use your reaction to magically become invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you complete a rest.

feat.name: Five Finger Discount*
entries: You've always been a slippery little Goblin. It's just what your people do, right? You gain the following benefits:

items: You become proficient in Sleight of Hand. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise.
You have advantage on Dexterity (sleight of hand) checks to pickpocket others.

feat.name: Peacekeeper*
entries: In your old world, now burnt to nothing, you were a protector of the holy and the weak. Now, you can be that again. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Insight, Investigation, and Perception checks for spotting criminals or crime-related activity.
You have advantage on Intimidation against criminals.

feat.name: Charming Presence*
entries: You've always been a dashing individual, superb in physical attributes. Those eyes. Mmf. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Persuasion checks against members of the opposite sex.
You gain Surprise Attack benefits when attacking a member of the opposite sex before an initiative is rolled.

feat.name: Father's Fury*
entries: Your inner rage burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you hit with an attack using a simple or martial weapon, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon's damage type. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Immediately after you use your Relentless Endurance trait, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack.

feat.name: Bountiful Luck*
entries: Your people have always been blessed with luck, and you've learned to lend it to your companions. You just wish, and it happens! You gain the following benefits:

items: When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a natural 1 on a d20 for an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll. They must use the second roll. When you use this reaction, you cannot use your Lucky racial feat until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Prodigy*
entries: Blessed with the Blood of Man and the adaptability of a demigod, you have a knack for learning new things. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain one Skill proficiency, one tool proficiency, and two language proficiencies of your choice.
You gain expertise in one Skill in which you were previously proficienct.

feat.name: Golden Child*
entries: You can feel yourself growing closer to decay, but it only makes you more powerful. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Persuasion. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise.
Your Feeding die increases so that it now does 1d6 + CON modifier damage and healing.

feat.name: Advanced Communications*
entries: Your time in this new world has helped to develop your ability to communicate with the primates of this world who lack your telepathic abilities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in two languages of your choice.

As an action, you can link your telepathic mind to that of another willing lesser being. As long as the being you link with can speak a language, you will be able to communicate telepathically back and forth, so long as your connection is not severed by a mind shield.

feat.name: Feral Connection*
entries: You and your animal form become united, your personalities intertwined and your powers connected. You gain the following benefits:

items: While in your Wild Shape, you can now add double your proficiency bonus to damage rolls.
After you have reached 5th level, your wild shape gains an Extra Attack.

feat.name: Pray for Mercy*
entries: Though you may be pitiful, your silver tongue might make you grand one day. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in either Persuasion or Deception.
You have advantage when use Persuasion or Deception against any creature with Draconic blood or Draconic acnestry.

feat.name: Cricket Legs*
entries: Your sturdy legs have only improved since coming to the surface, and people like to hear your take on things. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Acrobatics, if you were already proficient your proficiency becomes Expertise.
Your Persuasive Voice is enough for you to gain Advantage on any Persuasion check.

feat.name: Lewd*
entries: It's pretty simple when you think about it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage when using Persuasion against males of any species.
When using a Bonus Action to change your size, you can be considered Small if below 3ft.

feat.name: Savagery*
entries: The chieftons smile upon you, true-blood. Bring Apothis' hell upon our enemies! You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain an additional Critical Damage Dice.
You gain the Relentless Endurance racial ability of the Half-Orcs.

feat.name: Tree of Bohdi*
entries: You meditate on the wisdom of the ancients, recalling the lessons you were taught in Hearth. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can choose an additional Dharma talent from the Parami's list. This feat can be taken more than once to gain additional talents.

feat.name: Beyond the Grave*
entries: Death could not hold you, and neither can mortality. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain the ability to sew your wounds back together. Once per day, as a Bonus Action, you can heal yourself with ethereal energy. Regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 + your CON modifier.
You gain the ability to see into the Ethereal plane up to your normal sight range.

feat.name: Flames of Phlegethos*
entries: You learn to call upon hellfire to serve your commands. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a spell that casts fire damage, you can reroll any damage roll that comes out as a 1, but you must use the second roll even if it is another 1.

Whenever you cast a spell that causes fire damage, you can cause flames to wreathe you until the end of your next turn. These flames do not harm you or your possessions. You will shed bright light out to 30 ft and sim light for an additional 30 ft. While the flames are present, any creature within 5ft of you that hits you with a melee attack takes 1d4 fire damage.

feat.name: Guardian of the Seas*
entries: Bael wishes he was as good at swimming as you are, but he's dead after siding with Martyn. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are swimming, you can use your bonus action to take the dash action.
You get the ability to cast {@spell Wall of Water|yastah} once per day when you reach 5th level.

feat.name: Survival of the Cunning*
entries: You gain the ability to always appear as your perfect person to those with True Sight or any ability to see through transformations. If you do change into something else they will still only see you as your perfect person instead of the new form or your true form. Those that suspect you can make an Investigation check vs 8+PB+CHA to determine you are not normal.

feat.name: Numb*
entries: The ice in your blood grows ever colder as you grow in power. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Cold damage bonus on melee weapons becomes a 1d6.
Once per day as an action, you can surround yourself with ice. For one minute, everything within 10ft of you becomes difficult terrain.

feat.name: Huntsman's Blessing*
entries: Your study of Fey lore has unlocked a fey power that few others possess. Drawing on your ancestry, you can momentarily stride through the Nexus of Yastah to shorten your path from one place to another. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan if you cannot already.
You learn the cantrip {@spell Blink Step|yastah}, and case use the spells {@spell Misty Step|yastah} and {@spell Blink|yastah} once per day without expending a Spell Slot.

feat.name: Shield of the Sisters*
entries: In the grace of Anu, you are protected by the elements that serve you. Drawing on your ancestry, you can create and aura around you to shield you from attackers. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: As a Bonus Action, you can create a 5ft aura around you with the element of your choice from Fire, Lightning, Cold, or Force, which will last for up to a minute or until you dispel it as a free action. Whenever a hostile enters the aura, they take 1d4 + your CON modifier of your selected damage type, and must make a CON save with a DC based on your CON modifier or be unable to attack you until the beginning of their next turn. You can activate this aura only once per day.

feat.name: Breath of the Bay*
entries: Ryujin has blessed the blood of your forefathers with the greatest power his beasts and guardians possess: Dragonfire, a flame far stronger and hotter than anything the mortals can hope to achieve. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write Draconic if you cannot already.

Once per day you can use the breath weapon Dragonfire. You breath a bright green cone of fire up to 30 ft. All creatures caught in the cone must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Charisma modifier or take 3d6 fire damage (which will pierce resistances), or half as much on a successful save. The target will also remain burned, taking 1d4 fire damage at the beginning of each pf their turns. The target can make CON saves at the end of their turn to try and put out the flame, with a DC based o your CHA modifier, or continue to burn.

feat.name: Child of Yastah*

choose.entry: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: Yastah is your world. It always has been, and it always will be as long as you have a say in the matter. Through your studies of Luna and Soual, and of the first empire of Ereborn, you learn that you were made to be adaptable, and so you shall be. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: You become proficient in two new skills, or gain expertise in one skill you already have proficiency in.

Once per day, you can calm a situation by invoking your dominance. When it seems combat is about to begin, if no stikes have yet been made by you or your allies, you can use a bonus action to intimidate your enemy to stand down peacefully. You will have advantage on this Intimidation, and all hostiles will have disadvantage on their Will saves. Any hostile who fails their Will save will be too afraid to fight you or your party unless they are provoked by further violence.

feat.name: Warborn's Fury*
entries: Apothis and Merric dine on the devastation that you bring with your fury, and grant you the power to draw even more blood from your enemies in their names. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: Once per day you can enter an Orcish Rage as a Bonus Action. For the next 2 rounds, you are resistant to all Piercing, Slashing, or Bludgeoning damage from non-magical weapons. For every attack action in which you do not make at least 1 successful attack, your Rage extends for 1 round, but will immediately end if you do not attempt to do damage on your turn. During this Rage, you also do an additional 2 damage with your attacks, and can still cast spells. This Rage cannot stack with Barbarian Rage.

feat.name: One Last Favor*
entries: Though Beyt is no more, he hasn't left his greatest creations without a final blessing, to aid them in their new world. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: As a Goliath, your Stone Endurance roll increases to a 1d20, and as a Jezeval you gain the Stone Endurance trait of the Goliaths with a 1d8 die.
Once per day you can cast {@spell Tongues|yastah} on yourself without expending a spell slot.

feat.name: Call of the Wild*
entries: Nature is within you, for you are a part of it. You have learned that with time and effort, you can channel your natural ancestry. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: You can ritually cast {@spell Speak with Animals|yastah} in order to communicate with your animal friends.

Once per day, you can summon an animal companion to accompany you. It must be a beast, and must be CR 1 or below. These beasts have their own turns in initiative (though may not have their own roll depending on the will of the DM) and their stats to do not escalate with your level.

feat.name: Archangel*
entries: Daijizaten's warmth is still ever present in your heart, and his peaceful motives spread to your mind even if bloodshed is in your nature. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: Once per day, you can escape harm by creating a burst of blinding light. As an action, you cause yourself to glow violently, making every hostile creature within 30 ft of you roll a CON save against your CHA modifier or become {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. Immediately after using this effect, you and any ally within 10 ft of you can {@action dash} as a Bonus Action for 3 rounds.

feat.name: Vampiric Physique*
entries: The blood of hellspawn runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some fiends. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: You gain resistance to your choice of either Cold of Poison damage.
Once per rest, you can shrug off damage taken. As a reaction, roll a {@dice 1d10} and add your CON modifier. The total of the roll is reduced from the damage you take

feat.name: Call of the Void*

choose.entry: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: You have risen from the ashes, from the bones and the blood, to be born anew. Let your power seep into the world. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain the {@spell Toll the Dead|yastah} cantrip, and the ability to cast {@pell Inflict Wounds|yastah}, {@spell Vampiric Touch|yastah} (at Character level 5 or higher), and {@spell Contagion|yastah} (at character level 9 or higher) once per day

feat.name: Deaos' Trance*
entries: You've searched your dream-state for the gifts Deaos left upon your people and found within yourself the ability to enforce your dream-state upon others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain the ability (At character level 9 or higher) to cast {@spell Chloroform|yastah} once per day without expending a Spell Slot.

Once per day while wearing a face that is not your perfect persona, you can create a dreamy aura around you that convinces people you are the person you claim to be without needing to roll deception or performance checks and lasts for 10 minutes. This ability will not effect anyone that saw you change your form, and due to the concentration it takes to keep the aura active, it cannot be used while you are in combat. If combat begins while you are using the Trance, it will immediately end. If your Trance ends while you are tricking someone, they must make the regular DC to see through your illusion or continue to be convinced by it until you give them a reason to doubt you.

feat.name: Crystal Touched*
entries: The crystal's touch upon your life has made it more difficult for the gods' agents to influence you. You gain the Following Benefits:

items: Since there are still very few Elysians on the surface, surface dwelling creatures have a hard time reading your non-verbal clues. Gain advantage on any Deception checks against any non-Elysian creatures.

Once per day when a divine caster (Clerics/Paladins/Warlocks) cast a spell targeting you, you gain advantage on the save vs their spell or +5 to your AC vs their spell. You also have resistance to any damage taken from the spell.

feat.name: Centurion's Blessing*
entries: The Centurion knows that you can't really count on anyone else to fix you, you need to take care of yourself and grants you the knowledge to do it slightly better. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can now add your proficiency bonus to all self applied heals . (Spare Parts, Repair Kit, Hairline Fracture, Tempered Glass, Prime Sentience, {@spell Fabricate|yastah} if you cast it on yourself).

feat.name: Honorable*
entries: By the power of Sigalo, you become better at doing the honorable thing. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain advantage against fear effects.
Each allied creature within 5 feet of you confers a +1 bonus to all attack you would make while in melee range of the target, to a maximum of +3.
